question.text: Parthenocarpic tomato fruits can be produced by

options.text: treating the plants with phenylmercuric acetate
removing androecium of flowers before pollen grains are released.
treating the plants with low concentrations or gibberellic acid and auxins
raising the plants from vernalized seeds

solution.text: Seedless fruits are produced by parthenocarpy. It can be artificially induced by the application of plant hormones such as auxin and GA. Removal of androecium, before pollen release is called emasculation which is helpful in preventing unwanted pollination. Vernalized seeds are the chill treated seeds for breaking dormancy. Phenyl mercuric acetate is an anti-transpirant.
